result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Patrick Witt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $644.00 to Pick N Save; $350.00 to Pizza Hut.  To be paid first, before other costs/surcharges.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge in counts one and two, costs and disbursements.
AS TO RESTITUTION/COSTS/SURCHARGES:  Monies to be collected by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.   Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full, and supervision fees would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with:  Subway at 6733 W. North Avenue, Wauwatosa; Subway at 9135 W. Greenfield Ave, West Allis; One Stop Shop at 5909 W. Greenfield Avenue, West Allis; Tammy V.; Pick N Save at 8151 W. Bluemound Road, Wauwatosa; Pizza Hut at 3222 W. Looms Road, Greenfield;  all in Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinkig intervention counseling.

AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
**Conditions apply to counts one and two.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised of voting ineligibility.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Patrick Witt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 10, 2014 received and filed.
Per Order signed on February 10, 2015:  Extended supervison on counts one and two, each count,   to be corrected to read three (3) years.
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

Attorney Megan L. Morrisey in court, defendant Christopher Patrick Witt not in court, in custody. Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel will be assigning this case to another member of her office and requested an adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Christopher Patrick Witt in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Christopher Patrick Witt in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Parties request an adjournment of the sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Megan L. Morrisey in court, defendant Christopher Patrick Witt not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Tyrone St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date and advised that an OTP would be needed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court, defendant Christopher Patrick Witt not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant may have new charges issued against him; parties request another date to allow case to be formally charged.  Court granted joint request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court, defendant Christopher Patrick Witt not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is adjourned for scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION, Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew) GPS Monitoring.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Subway Restaurant, Satish P. Hanna F-S. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  State turned over discovery to Defense. Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Christopher Patrick Witt in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Christopher Patrick Witt in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
